reviewText: The first episode of this fourth season, AN EXERCISE IN FATALITY, was broadcasted in september 1974. It's also possible to watch this episode in the DVD standard by purchasing Columbo - The Complete Fourth Season. This is the second Columbo episode directed by Bernard L. Kowalski after Columbo Collector's Edition: Death Lends A Hand, and the third and last episode written by Larry Cohen after the brilliant Columbo Collector's Edition: Any Old Port In A Storm and CANDIDATE FOR CRIME. In this episode, Lt. Columbo must confound the health club owner Robert -Milo Janus- Conrad who murdered Gene Stafford, a man who was about to reveal Milo Janus's frauds. Janus is one of the rare murderers Lt. Columbo doesn't regard with esteem. Hatred is almost tangible between the two characters as soon as they meet. A VHS to keep in your library.
